text: Tectonic map of the Tibetan Plateau showing location of the Kunlun fault The Kunlun fault is a strike-slip fault to the north side of Tibet. Slippage along the long fault has occurred at a constant rate for the last 40,000 years. This has resulted in a cumulative offset of more than . The fault is seismically active, most recently causing the magnitude 7.8 2001 Kunlun earthquake. ==References== Category:Seismic faults of Asia Category:Strike-slip faults Category:Geology of Tibet Category:Geology of China Category:Kunlun Mountains Category:Tibetan Plateau Category:Supershear earthquakes
title: Kunlun Fault
